titleStmt.title: The compleat history of the vvarrs in Scotland under the conduct of the illustrious and truly-valiant Iames Marquesse of Montrose, General for his Majestie Charls 1st. in that kingdome, together vvith a brief character of him, as also a true relation of his forein negotiations, landing, defeat, apprehension, tryal, and deplorable death in the time of Charls 2d.
De rebus auspiciis serenissimi, & potentissimi Caroli. English
titleStmt.author: Wishart, George, 1599-1671.
Pontius, Paulus, 1603-1658, engraver.

editionStmt.edition: Now newly corrected and enlarged by an eye-witnesse of all the fore-mentioned passages.

notesStmt.note: A translation, with additions, of: Wishart, George. De rebus auspiciis serenissimi, & potentissimi Caroli.
Title page in red and black.
The portrait is signed: P. Pontius sculpsit.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
